intro: Elleanthus hirsutis, commonly known as the hairy elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which provide protection against herbivores and excessive moisture loss. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elleanthus hirsutis is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
